meanings.definition: A sudden, quick movement or jerk
meanings.sent1: The cat's tail twitches when it sees a bird.
meanings.sent2: I felt a twitches in my leg when I heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent3: The twitches of the rabbit's nose made it look like it was dancing.
meanings.sent4: Her eyelid twitched like a tiny dancer on stage.
meanings.sent5: The twitches of the fish's fins were mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden, quick movement or jerk
meanings.sent1: She twitches her nose when she smells something strange.
meanings.sent2: The doctor asked me to twitches my fingers to test my reflexes.
meanings.sent3: He twitches the curtain open to peek outside.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches twitched in the wind like restless spirits.
meanings.sent5: I twitches the rope to see if it was securely tied.
